Hi—my name is Mitchell Kember. I’m a Software Engineering student at the University of Waterloo. Last summer I finished my 4A school term, and now I’m on co-op in California working for Facebook.

Here are a few projects I’ve worked on in the past:

  • Eva, a Scheme interpreter written in C
  • Analysis I, a formalization of an analysis textbook in Lean
  • Lindenmayer, a fractal curve web app powered by Go
  • Lam, a small λ-calculus language built in Haskell

In my final year of high school, I made course notes for Chemistry, Physics, and Calculus. I’m continuing to share them here:

  • SCH4U
  • SPH4U
  • MCV4U
